text.0: If you want to know what keeps me going in this industry and why I remain hopeful and energized, this is a pretty good summary. Thanks to @AmPress for letting me rant about why service journalism is so important right now: https://t.co/YnJbDWTQvK
text.1:
Learn how the @ExpressNews's COVID-19 timeline generated more than 600 digital subscriptions and one million page views.
#TableStakes https://t.co/ZmHuQ1Cffr
text.2: "Service journalism" is often derided, associated with listicles, how-to's and women's magazines, says @griffithgreene. But it's really about "increasing understanding, making people feel informed and giving them the tools to be more involved."
text.3: Accessible like this how-to-vote guide (offered in 5 languages) that allows readers to quickly navigate to information relating to their personal circumstances. https://t.co/ALX3mYGoaa
text.4:
At the @PhillyInquirer “service journalism” means making stories both actionable and accessible.

Actionable like this tenants’ rights guide that explains what to do if tenants are facing eviction or need to break their lease early. https://t.co/JrAFiDzXG9
text.5:
Journalists, if you have five minutes for a thoughtful read today, make it this one. 

(And if not, we’ve pulled the takeaways in 3 following tweets.)
https://t.co/wFCan9gNxk
